Autophagy can prevent accumulation of ce: Can autophagy prevent accumulation of cellular waste? Role of autophagy in cellular waste management

This cellular garbage disposal and intracellular recycling provided by autophagy serves to maintain cellular homeostasis by eliminating superfluous or damaged proteins and organelles, and invading microbes, or to provide substrates for energy generation and biosynthesis in stress.
Can autophagy prevent accumulation of cellular waste? Role of autophagy in cellular waste management

Autophagy is a fundamental cellular homeostasis program that deals with harmful or surplus cellular contents such as protein aggregates, dysfunctional/long-lived organelles, intracellular pathogens, and storage nutrients (glycogen and lipid droplets) [1,2,3,4].
Accumulation of cellular waste component: Does accumulation of cellular waste affect cell function? Impact of cellular waste on cell function

The presence of waste products changes the structural organization of the cell. Cellular components are displaced by these waste products and cellular functions such as cell signaling, transport of cellular molecules, and metabolic functions are impeded.
Does accumulation of cellular waste affect cell function? Impact of cellular waste on cell function

Building up cellular waste is bad news for cells, and particularly for neurons. Such excessive build up can lead to neurological conditions, as is the case of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), also called Lou Gehrig's disease.
